segments.text: I see the woman, absorbed in her task, with water dangerously pooling at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not see the mess? It’s escalating right under her nose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children, on the other hand, don’t seem to feel the weight of any impending disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is focused on that cookie jar like it's a pot of gold at the end of a rainbow.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel my heart race as I watch him balance precariously on that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s anticipation adds to the tension; she looks ready to cheer him on.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost taste the sweetness of those cookies and feel the thrill of their mission.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I look at the water spilling over the cabinets and feel a sense of dread.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunshine outside makes everything feel so calm, yet inside, it’s a brewing storm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could warn them, but I doubt they would listen in their excitement.
segments.speaker: PAR
